definition: four seasons like spring/favorable climate throughout the year
season/the last month of a season/fourth or youngest amongst brothers/classifier for seasonal crop yields

sentences.english: In order to pine timber, never to the four seasons such as spring greenhouse gallantry.
sentences.chinese: 爲了成材，松樹從不向四季如春的溫室外獻殷勤。

sentences.english: Thee beauty of the winter scene let me forget the cold, feel four spring-like.
sentences.chinese: 冬天的美麗景象讓我忘記了寒冷，感覺四季如春。

sentences.english: That's correct. We have four seasons of spring.
sentences.chinese: 聽說這兒的天氣很宜人，彷彿四季如春。

sentences.english: Yunnan is a permanent spring-like, summer rainy city.
sentences.chinese: 雲南是一個四季如春，夏季多雨的城市。

sentences.english: With mild spring like weather all the year around, Gulangyu is reputed as a garden on the sea.
sentences.chinese: 鼓浪嶼上氣候怡人，四季如春，素有海上花園的美稱。

definition: lit. birdsong and fragrant flowers (idiom); fig. the intoxication of a beautiful spring day
a world of ice and snow
(idiom) sunlight shines over all things/drenched in sunlight
four seasons, namely: spring 春, summer 夏, autumn 秋 and winter 冬
lit. verdant hills and limpid water (idiom)/fig. enchanting scenery
lit. verdant hills and limpid water (idiom)/fig. enchanting scenery
heaven on Earth/nickname for the city Suzhou
brilliant white snow cover (esp. of distant peaks)
to escape the cold by going on a winter holiday
